item.title: Iran Nuclear Talks Are Extended for Another Day
item.description: Negotiations over Iran’s nuclear program were extended again after they were beset by competing claims and recriminations.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. GORDON
item.media:description: Secretary of State John Kerry on Wednesday in Lausanne, Switzerland.

item.title: Russia Shuts Down TV Station Serving Crimean Tatars
item.description: Regulators rejected four applications filed by ATR, which members of the Tatar minority said reflected a continuing pattern of discrimination.
item.dc:creator: NEIL MacFARQUHAR

item.title: Prosecutors Ease Crackdown on Buyers of China-Bound Luxury Cars
item.description: Federal authorities in South Carolina, Florida, Georgia and Ohio have settled these export disputes by returning all of the seized cars.
item.dc:creator: MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN
item.media:credit: Jake Naughton for The New York Times
item.media:description: Alibek Turkayev, a former luxury car exporter, battled federal prosecutors for nearly two years before they agreed to drop a civil forfeiture lawsuit.

item.title: Palestinians Join International Criminal Court, but Tread Cautiously at First
item.description: The Palestinians refrained from immediately asking the court to look into cases that may implicate Israeli officials in what they say are war crimes.
item.dc:creator: DIAA HADID and MARLISE SIMONS
item.media:description: Foreign Minister Riad al-Malki of the Palestinian Authority with a copy of the Rome Statute at a ceremony on Tuesday in The Hague to welcome the Palestinians into the International Criminal Court.

item.title: A Newly Assertive Russia Jolts Norway’s Air Defenses Into Action
item.description: The Russian moves have set off debate over military spending and highlighted how quickly President Vladimir V. Putin has shredded the certainties of the post-Cold War era.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW HIGGINS
item.media:credit: Bryan Denton for The New York Times
item.media:description: The pilot of a Norwegian Air Force F-16 fighter from the 331st Air Squadron exited his aircraft upon returning to the air base in Bodo from a mission to observe Russian military aircraft flying over the Arctic.

item.title: Lens Blog: After Horror in Libya, Christians’ Grief in an Egyptian Village
item.description: When militants from the Islamic State in Libya killed 21 Egyptian Christians, Jonathan Rashad went to the village many called home to understand the devastating impact.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ANDREW BORYGA
item.media:description: The mother of a slain 25-year-old laborer, Malak Ibrahim. “I'm proud of my son. He did not change his faith till the last moment of death. I thank God. Malak is with his father now. Jesus. He is taking care of him.”

item.title: ISIS Said to Step Up Offensive in Syria
item.description: Islamic State militants are reported to have launched offensives on two fronts — in the province of Hama and near Damascus, residents said.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD

item.title: Boehner and Netanyahu, Meeting in Israel, Keep It Low Key
item.description: The American House speaker and the Israel prime minister seemed to take pains to avoid stirring any new controversy.
item.dc:creator: JODI RUDOREN
item.media:description: Speaker John A. Boehner and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel in Jerusalem on Wednesday.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Claims of Retaliation in Detention of Chinese Anticorruption Campaigner
item.description: Ou Shaokun’s supporters question whether the charges of soliciting a prostitute represent a reprisal by officials angered by his investigations.
item.category: Central Commission for Discipline Inspection (Communist Party of China)
item.dc:creator: PATRICK BOEHLER and JESS MACY YU
item.media:description: Ou Shaokun offering a toast to villagers in the partly demolished village of Xian in Guangzhou in 2013.

item.title: U.S. Expands Foreign Cyberattack Retaliation Options
item.description: President Obama signed an executive order that would impose financial and travel sanctions against foreign-based hackers targeting the United States.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: PETER BAKER

item.title: Germanwings Crash Casts Pall on Lufthansa Anniversary
item.description: The airline is facing perhaps the worst crisis in its history, as anger in Germany is increasingly directed toward the company and its chief executive.
item.dc:creator: JACK EWING and NICOLA CLARK
item.media:description: Carsten Spohr, left, the chief executive of Lufthansa, and Thomas Winkelmann, the chief executive of Germanwings, at a plane crash memorial on Wednesday in Seyne-les-Alpes, France.

item.title: Explosion at Dairy Factory in Yemen Kills Dozens
item.description: The deaths occurred in Al Hudaydah as Saudi-led forces continued their military offensive against the Houthis.
item.dc:creator: MOHAMMED ALI KALFOOD and KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Supporters of Detained Feminists in China Petition for Their Release
item.description: The petition, said to have been signed by more than 1,100 people, was sent to public security and other state offices. It called for the release of the five women and denounced the police action as “illegal in multiple ways.”
item.dc:creator: DIDI KIRSTEN TATLOW
item.media:description: A person in front of a post box on Tuesday prepares to mail a copy of a petition calling on the Chinese government to release five detained feminists.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Taiwan’s Bid to Join China-led Development Bank Hits Early Snags
item.description: Moves by Taiwan to join the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank have prompted protests at home and raised sensitive questions of sovereignty for the self-governed island.
item.dc:creator: AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: Wang Jin-pyng, fourth from the right, the speaker of the Taiwan Legislature, speaking after a meeting on Wednesday with Prime Minister Mao Chi-kuo, fifth from the right, and with Ker Chien-ming, third from the right, of the opposition Democratic Progressive Party.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Yemen Evacuation Shows Chinese Navy’s Growing Role
item.description: The Chinese ambassador to Yemen described the evacuation of nearly 600 people as “a significant practice of major power diplomacy with Chinese characteristics.”
item.dc:creator: JANE PERLEZ and YUFAN HUANG
item.media:description: Chinese preparing to leave Yemen from the western port city of Al Hudaydah on Monday.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: South Koreans and Adultery
item.description: The decriminalization of adultery is a step forward for personal rights, but most South Koreans don’t see it that way.
item.dc:creator: HAILJI

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: A New Language for Pakistan’s Deaf
item.description: Can sign language and the web brighten the lives of 1.25 million children?
item.dc:creator: BINA SHAH

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Nasser’s Ghost Hovers Over Yemen
item.description: In 1962 Egypt invaded Yemen and Saudi Arabia intervened. Is history repeating itself?
item.dc:creator: JESSE FERRIS

item.title: Conference to Aid Syrians Falls Short of Expectations
item.description: Delegates to an international fund-raising conference for victims of the Syrian war pledged $3.8 billion, less than half the emergency humanitarian assistance sought by the United Nations for this year.
item.dc:creator: RICK GLADSTONE
item.media:description: Syrians displaced by the conflict in their country at a settlement near Mafraq, Jordan, in March.

item.title: World Briefing: Mexico: Death Toll Rises in Explosion of Crashed Gas Tanker
item.description: The toll in the explosion of a gasoline tanker truck in southeastern Mexico rose to 14 on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
